thread.title: All-time winners of The Clash at Daytona International Speedway
thread.title_full: All-time winners of The Clash at Daytona International Speedway

author: Brian
title: All-time winners of The Clash at Daytona International Speedway
text:
Feb 10, 2017 at 6:28p ET 0Shares 
Since 1979, there have been 21 different winners of the Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona International Speedway (Feb. 18, 8 p.m. ET, FS1). 
As we are set to kick off the 2017 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series season with the exhibition race, check out the all-time winners of the Clash: RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Buddy Baker, 1 win 
Baker won the inaugural Clash at Daytona in 1979 driving the No. 28 car, also known as the “Gray Ghost.” Darrell Waltrip, 1 
Driving for legendary car owner Junior Johnson, Waltrip took the No. 11 Buick to Victory Lane in the 1981 running of The Clash. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Bobby Allison, 1 
Allison won both The Clash and the Daytona 500 in 1982 driving the No. 88 Gatorade-sponsored Buick Regal. This content is subject to copyright. ISC Archives via Getty Images Terry Labonte, 1 
In 1985, “Texas Terry” won the exhibition race in the No. 44 Hagan Racing Chevrolet. Bill Elliott, 1 
Elliott took his No. 9 Melling Racing Ford to Victory Lane in both The Clash and the Daytona 500. Focus on Sport Focus on Sport/Getty Images Geoff Bodine, 1 
It was all Geoff Bodine in the 1990 running of The Clash at Daytona, driving the No. 11 Ford for Junior Johnson. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Rusty Wallace, 1 
The 1989 Cup Series champion won the Clash this special No. 2 Penske Racing Ford Taurus paint scheme in 1998. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Mark Martin, 1 
Although the Daytona 500 eluded the Hall of Fame driver, Martin drove his No. 6 Roush Racing Ford to victory in the 1999 Clash at Daytona. This content is subject to copyright. Getty Images Jimmie Johnson, 1 
Johnson began his fourth full season driving the No. 48 Hendrick Motorsports Chevrolet with a Clash win in 2005. copyright ©Robt.LeSieur Kurt Busch, 1 
While driving the No. 22 Team Penske Dodge, Busch was victorious in the 2011 exhibition race. Brian Czobat / LAT Photo USA © 271 Fryling Ave SW Concord, NC 28025 W 704.786.2919 C 704.904.2745 LAT Photo USA/Brian Czobat Kyle Busch, 1 
It was a sweet victory for the 2015 Cup champion in The Clash at Daytona in 2012. ©F.Peirce Williams ref: RAW (.NEF) file available Matt Kenseth, 1 
The two-time Daytona 500 winner earned his only win in the exhibition race driving the No. 20 Joe Gibbs Racing Toyota in 2015. © F. Peirce Williams Neil Bonnett, 2 
Bonnett won the 1983 Clash driving for RahMac Enterprises, and again in 1984 in his first year with Junior Johnson. This content is subject to copyright. ISC Archives via Getty Images Ken Schrader, 2 
Schrader won back-to-back exhibition races at Daytona (1989 and 1990). RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Jeff Gordon, 2 
In his second full-time season driving the iconic No. 24 Hendrick Motorsports Chevrolet, Gordon won the 1994 Clash. The four-time Cup champion and current FOX NASCAR analyst did it again in 1997, the same year he won his first Daytona 500. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images Dale Earnhardt Jr., 2 
The two-time Daytona 500 champion also has a pair of Clash victories (2003, 2008) to go along with his stellar record at Daytona. world copyright Robt LeSieur Dale Jarrett, 3 
Jarrett backed up his 2000 win in the exhibition race with his second victory in the Daytona 500. Robt.LeSieur 2002 NASCAR BUDWEISER SHOOTOUT FEBRUARY 
Stewart joins Ken Schrader and Neil Bonnett as the only three drivers to win back-to-back Clash events (2001, 2002). “Smoke” won the exhibition race again in 2007. F.Peirce Williams 2013 NASCAR Daytona Sprint Unlimited 
© Lesley Ann Miller ©2013 Lesley Ann Miller NASCAR: The Sprint Unlimited 
Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports Dale Earnhardt
